University of Utah: The University of Utah (UU, U of U, or simply Utah)[12] is a public research university in Salt Lake City, Utah. It was established in 1850 as the University of Deseret (/ˌdɛzəˈrɛt/ ⓘ)[13] by the General Assembly of the provisional State of Deseret,[1] making it Utah's oldest institution of higher education.[14] It received its current name in 1892, four years before Utah attained statehood, and moved to its current location in 1900.[1] Along with Utah State University, UU is one of two formally recognized flagship universities by the state of Utah; UU is the largest public university in the state of Utah in total budget, revenue, endowment size, and total research expenditures.
